An Overview of htmlwidgets

A brief overview of htmlwidgets in R

Author

Ella Kaye

Published

May 25, 2017

Contents

  • Overview
  • Event details
  • Key points
  • Slides - fill in iframe and link in last bullet point

Report an issue

slides materials

Overview

The htmlwidgets package allows developers to create R bindings to JavaScript libraries. The resulting R packages allow the embedding of interactive content in R Markdown documents and Shiny web apps. There are over 50 available widgets. In this talk I give an overview of the htmlwidget framework and demonstrate the use of the DT, leaflet and DiagrammeR packages.

Event details

Event: Warwick R User Group

Date: May 25th, 2017

Time: 17:00

Location: University of Warwick

Slides - fill in iframe and link in last bullet point

Keyboard shortcuts for slideshow (once you’ve clicked inside it):

  • Use ← and → to navigate through the slides.

  • Use o for an overview of all slides.

  • Use h to see a list of other shortcuts

    • f to toggle full screen not working, but the rest are fine.

    • For full screen slides, go to slides then press f.
